sense.gloss: to (finally) arrive at, to reach (at last), to (manage to) get to, to find one's way to
to follow (a road, path, etc.), to trace
to follow (a clue, scent, tracks, plot, etc.), to trace (a route, history, family tree, etc.), to retrace (e.g. one's memory), to search, to go over
to head towards (of a situation), to go in the direction of, to take (a course), to pursue (a path), to meet (a fate)
faltering, tottering, halting, unsteady, awkward, clumsy
to reach back into one's memory, to search one's mind, to recall
to trace back to (the origins of something)
to have a dream, to walk along the road of dreams

sdata.j: その↑少年↑↓しょうねん↓は↑海岸↑↓かいがん↓に↑辿↑↓たど↓り↑着↑↓つ↓こうと↑無駄↑↓むだ↓な↑努力↑↓どりょく↓をした。
sdata.e: The boy made vain efforts to reach the shore.

sdata.j: ↑今↑↓いま↓まであなたが↑辿↑↓たど↓った↑道↑↓みち↓を↑見↑↓み↓つめなおしてみましょう。
sdata.e: Let's look at the path that you've walked so far.

sdata.j: ↑険↑↓けわ↓しいその↑道↑↓みち↓を↑行↑↓い↓く↑以外↑↓いがい↓に、↑国境↑↓こっきょう↓へ↑辿↑↓たど↓り↑着↑↓つ↓く↑方法↑↓ほうほう↓はない。
sdata.e: The steep path is the sole access to the border.

sdata.j: ↑森↑↓もり↓の↑中↑↓なか↓の↑小道↑↓こみち↓を↑辿↑↓たど↓っていくのは↑楽↑↓たの↓しいことだ。
sdata.e: It's fun to follow the path through the woods.

sdata.j: ↑誰↑↓だれ↓が↑最初↑↓さいしょ↓にエベレストの↑山頂↑↓さんちょう↓に↑辿↑↓たど↓り↑着↑↓つ↓いたのですか。
sdata.e: Who first reached the summit of Mt. Everest?

sdata.j: ようやく↑辿↑↓たど↓りついたスキー↑場↑↓じょう↓・・・↑雪↑↓ゆき↓が↑雨↑↓あめ↓に↑変↑↓か↓わっていた。
sdata.e: We finally arrived at the ski hill... the snow had turned into rain.

sdata.j: ↑洗濯↑↓せんたく↓の↑耐久↑↓たいきゅう↓↑性↑↓せい↓やあらゆることを↑考慮↑↓こうりょ↓するとコチラに↑辿↑↓たど↓り↑着↑↓つ↓きました。
sdata.e: Bearing in mind the durability in washing and various factors this is what we arrived at:

sdata.j: その↑電話↑↓でんわ↓は↑南↑↓みなみ↓デトロイトからであると↑辿↑↓たど↓ることができた。
sdata.e: The call was traceable to an address in south Detroit.

sdata.j: ↑夜↑↓よる↓↑1↑↓いち↓↑時↑↓じ↓に↑家↑↓いえ↓に↑辿↑↓たど↓り↑着↑↓つ↓いたときには↑全身↑↓ぜんしん↓くたくたになっていた。
sdata.e: When I finally came home at 1 o'clock at night, my whole body was completely exhausted.

sdata.j: ↑巫山戯↑↓ふざけ↓ないで。この↑出会↑↓であ↓いは↑偶然↑↓ぐうぜん↓でも↑何↑↓なん↓でもない。↑疑↑↓うたぐ↓った↑所為↑↓せい↓で↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑俺↑↓おれ↓の↑足跡↑↓あしあと↓をずっと↑密↑↓ひそ↓かに↑辿↑↓たど↓っていただろう。
sdata.e: Stop joking around! We waven't just met here by mere coincidence. You've been following me in secret all this time because you suspected me.

words.gloss: to (finally) arrive at, to reach (at last), to (manage to) get to, to find one's way to
to follow (a road, path, etc.), to trace
faltering, tottering, halting, unsteady, awkward, clumsy
